benchmark_details.name: MathChat
benchmark_details.overview: MathChat is a comprehensive benchmark specifically designed to evaluate LLMs across a broader spectrum of mathematical tasks, focusing on multi-turn interactions and instruction-following abilities in conversations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance the development of a more generalized reasoner and assistant in mathematical contexts, particularly focusing on multi-turn mathematical reasoning and instruction-following.

data.source: The MathChat benchmark contains tasks sourced from the testing set of GSM8K, which were expanded using GPT-4 to suit specific requirements.
data.annotation: Automatically generated and verified with GPT-4 and other LLMs for accuracy.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the ground truth values for problem-solving accuracy and scores assigned for instruction-following tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores correspond to better understanding and adherence to instructions.
methodology.baseline_results: The performance is compared against various state-of-the-art LLMs.
methodology.validation: Empirical validation through extensive testing on multiple models trained on the benchmark.
